intro: Phyllanthus leonardorum, commonly known as Leonard's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
